column5: I bought a 10 pound bag of red potatoes in Canada and have 9 pounds left. Am I allowed to bring them back to the states? Thanks.
Yes you can. It's Canada at one time didn't want us to bring them because of the dirt that may have been left on them.

Just came back to the US through the Pigeon River border checkpoint and there was a new sign up saying "To avoid a substantial fine, declare all fruits and vegetables". So when asked if you are bringing anything back from Canada, just declare the potatoes.

When I crossed in May green peppers and green onions got the US border agents VERY excited. Won't bother with those items next month. Corn was another veggie they were looking for. Much easier to eat it or leave it!
